page.title: 09Quarrying Process
page.content: First the stone is{unbared}by removing the top soil.This is dumped on a large tip which is being landscaped and farmed.Next men {drill }holes of 13cms. diameter vertically into the rock to hold the explosive powder. Then{blasting}blows the rock away from the hillside. The stone is taken to a{ {processing plant}and the waste is removed. The stone is crushed in the Primary Crusher,then goes underground and onto a{conveyor}to be taken along for more crushing, milling and grading The end product is then ready for selling and transporting.There are ten different grades of stone. We stood about half a mile away to watch a{blast}in progress. We saw the explosion before the sound reached us. It left a pile of rock and a large cloud of dust drifted towards us.
